thread.title: Fiction Chronicle: The Communist’s Wife’s Manifesto
thread.title_full: Fiction Chronicle: The Communist’s Wife’s Manifesto - WSJ

author: Sam Sacks
title: Fiction Chronicle: The Communist’s Wife’s Manifesto
text: Lizzie Burns, the longtime helpmeet and, eventually, wife of communism’s co-founder, Friedrich Engels, opens Gavin McCrea’s impressive debut, “Mrs. Engels” (Catapult, 389 pages, $16.95), with a manifesto to rival that of her other half. The worth of a man, she declares, has nothing to do with his politics or personality. “What matters over and above the contents of his character . . . is the mint that jingles in his pockets. In the final reckoning, the good and the bad come to an even naught and the only thing left to recommend... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
